com.algolia.instantsearch.core.searchclient

Class SearchClient<Parameters,Results>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algolia.search.saas.Searchable
      • com.algolia.instantsearch.core.searchclient.SearchClient<Parameters,Results>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transformable<Parameters,Results>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultSearchClient

    public abstract class SearchClient<Parameters,Results>
extends com.algolia.search.saas.Searchable
implements Transformable<Parameters,Results>
    Base class used to implement a custom backend with Algolia You need to make sure to implement the following method: search(Object, SearchResultsHandler) map(Query) map(Object)

      • map

        public Parameters map(@NonNull
                      com.algolia.search.saas.Query query,
                      @NonNull
                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> disjunctiveFacets,
                      @NonNull
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.util.Collection<java.lang.String>> refinements)
        Description copied from interface: Transformable
        Transforms the Algolia params + disjunctive refinements to custom backend params.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Transformable<Parameters,Results>
        Parameters:
        query - Search parameters. May be null to use an empty query.
        disjunctiveFacets - List of disjunctive facets.
        refinements - The current refinements, mapping facet names to a list of values.
        Returns:
        The search parameters with the custom format required by the custom back-end implementation

      • map

        public org.json.JSONObject map(@NonNull
                               Results results)
        Description copied from interface: Transformable
        Transforms the custom backend result to Algolia results.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Transformable<Parameters,Results>
        Parameters:
        results - Content that was returned by your custom API (in case of success).
        Returns:
        json object from your custom results. It has to match the parameters defined in SearchResults.SearchResults(JSONObject)

        public Parameters map(@Nullable
                      com.algolia.search.saas.Query query,
                      @NonNull
                      java.lang.String facetName,
                      @NonNull
                      java.lang.String matchingText)
        Description copied from interface: Transformable
        Transforms the Algolia facet value params to custom backend params.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Transformable<Parameters,Results>
        Parameters:
        query - Search parameters. May be null to use an empty query.
        facetName - The name of the facet to search.
        matchingText - The text to search for in the facet's values.
        Returns:
        The search parameters with the custom format required by the custom back-end implementation
